page.title: 17RELIGIOUS LIFE
page.content:
Most of the area is in the Anglican Parish of Treverbyn. It has a population of 4000 of whom 61 are on the Church electoral roll with an average of 48 regular communicants. There is no Sunday school or Youth Club. Numbers of baptisms, weddings and funerals have remained relatively constant over the last 5 years. Fund raising continues through the year with an annual fete, Christmas bazaar, treasure hunts, country dancing and jumble sales in the Church Hall.
The Reverend Janet Knowles-Berry, one of 5 women ministers in Cornwall, is the Methodist minister of Trethurgy Chapel. The number of methodists have halved in the last 5 years. With an average congregation of 6, the Chapel closed in July 1985. Penwithick Chapel now serves the whole area.
